MagneticSolutionCartStaticÔÉÅ

class pyrit.solution.MagneticSolutionCartStatic(description: str, vector_potential: ndarray, tri_mesh: mesh.TriMesh, tri_cart_edge_shape_function: shapefunction.TriCartesianEdgeShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations)ÔÉÅ

Bases: StaticSolution

Solution of a static, two-dimensional magnetic problem in Cartesian coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is MagneticProblemCartStatic.

Constructor

Parameters

  • description (str) ‚Äì Description of the solution.

  • vector_potential (np.ndarray) ‚Äì An array that represents the potential.

  • tri_mesh (mesh.TriMesh) ‚Äì The mesh object.

  • tri_cart_edge_shape_function (shapefunction.TriCartesianEdgeShapeFunction) ‚Äì The shape function object.

  • regions (region.Regions) ‚Äì The regions object.

  • materials (material.Materials) ‚Äì The materials object.

  • excitations (excitations.Excitations) ‚Äì The excitations object.

solution_identifier: str = 'Solution of a static, tow-dimensional magnetostatic problem in Cartesian coordinates'ÔÉÅ

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

ignore_for_saving = ['_b_field', '_h_field', '_curlcurl_matrix', '_mass_one', '_load_vector']ÔÉÅ

List of attributes that are not saved

consistency_check()ÔÉÅ

Check if the solution is consistent.

property length: floatÔÉÅ

The length of the domain.

property vector_potential: ndarrayÔÉÅ

The vector potential. These are the coefficients for the basis functions.

Note that this vector does not represent the values of \(\vec{A}\). See the property vector_potential_field_values.

property vector_potential_field_valuesÔÉÅ

The field values of the vector potential.

property b_field: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Magnetic flux density. Array with two values (x- and y-component) per mesh element.

property h_field: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Magnetic field strength. Array with two values (x- and y-component) per mesh element.

property curlcurl_matrix: coo_matrixÔÉÅ

The curl-curl-matrix.

property load_vector: ndarrayÔÉÅ

The load vector. Array with one value per mesh node.

property mass_one: coo_matrixÔÉÅ

The identity mass matrix.

property current_density: ndarrayÔÉÅ

The current density.

property energy: floatÔÉÅ

The energy in the whole domain.

property energy_density: ndarrayÔÉÅ

The energy density. Array with one value per mesh node.

energy_in_regions(*region_ids: int) → floatÔÉÅ

Compute the energy in certain regions.

Parameters

region_ids (int) ‚Äì Region IDs of the regions to compute the energy in.

Returns

energy ‚Äì The energy

Return type

float

:raises ValueError : When the region of one ID is not two-dimensional.:

static absolute_field(field: ndarray)ÔÉÅ

Computes the absolute field.

Parameters

field (np.ndarray) ‚Äì The field. A (N,2) or a (2,N) array.

Returns

absolute_field ‚Äì The absolute value of the field. A (N,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

:raises ValueError : When the input array is not of one of ht expected shapes.:

initialize_attributes()ÔÉÅ

Initialize the protected attributes needed for the properties.

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → SolutionÔÉÅ

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) ‚Äì The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution ‚Äì A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → PathÔÉÅ

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) ‚Äì

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) ‚Äì A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path ‚Äì The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

classmethod solution_from_problem(description: str, problem: StaticProblem, solution: ndarray) → StaticSolutionÔÉÅ

  • problem (StaticProblem) ‚Äì A static problem.

  • solution (np.ndarray) ‚Äì The solution of the static problem.

Returns

static_solution

Return type
